intro: Verbesina szyszylowiczii, commonly known as the Polish beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, yellow-orange flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Verbesina szyszylowiczii is typically found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
